    Purchase Fence at Cayuga Capital

    Title | Fence at Cayuga Capital
    Photography | Robert Spiegelman
    Year | 2004
    Description | The Onondaga capital, Onondaga Castle, was burnt on April 12-13, 1779. It surrounds Rt. 11, near Onondaga.
    The Seneca capital, Little Beard's Town, was burnt on Sept. 14-15, 1779. It surrounds Rt. 39, near Geneseo.
    The Cayuga capital, Goi-O-Guen, was burnt on Sept. 22-23, 1779. It surrounds Rt. 90, near Aurora.
    Price | $19.99

    To Purchase via secure Paypal
